title: Hot Jazz, Cool Teacher: How One New Orleans Man Fosters Greatness
teaser: For struggling students, music can often be what keeps them going. The same is true for this New Orleans band director.
contentencoded:
Peanut butter and jelly. Abbott and Costello. New Orleans and marching bands.

Some things are inseparable.

The city best known for hot jazz is a wellspring of talented musicians. Where do they all come from? Oftentimes it's great teachers â€” like Sam Venable, the band director at Langston Hughes Academy, a middle school on Trafalgar Street.
